section.title: WMS layer configuration
section.para: A complete WMS layer configuration looks as follows:
As you can see, the bean class refers to the actual layer type: org.geomajas.layer.wms.WmsLayer.

The first property is the layer info object, which describes the metadata common to all raster layers. Visit the Geomajas developer guide to learn more about it. This guide will focus on the WMS specific configuration options.
The layer object contains some extra properties which are specifically tied to the WMS server. Some of these are required, some are optional.

row.entry: The base url of the WMS server. This is the base part (excluding the request parameters) of the url that would be called to execute a WMS request.
Version of the WMS protocol which should be used. Check your server configuration for possible values. This defaults to "1.1.1".
The mime type in which the images should be returned, for example "image/gif". Check your server configuration for possible values. This defaults to "image/png".
Some WMS servers support multiple styles for their layers. Check your server configuration for possible values.
You can define additional parameters which can be passed to the WMS server for each GetMap request. These are name/value pairs which are passed in org.geomajas.configuration.Parameter objects.

Optional basic or digest HTTP authentication. This bean is of the type: org.geomajas.layer.wms.WmsAuthentication. When set, the WMS request is automatically proxied to assure that credentials are not leaked to the client.

Allows you to force the use of a proxy to get the image. This can be useful if you want to hide the WMS URL (excluding the parameters that is). This is automatically enabled when the authentication property is set (to assure that credentials are not visible on the user).

section.para: The optional HTTP authentication allows the WMS layer to send user credentials to the WMS server in the HTTP headers. Although this is an option, often WMS server will be secured, and require such authentication. Below is an example of a WMS layer configuration that uses the HTTP authentication:
section.programlisting:
<bean name="wmsOrtho" class="be.geomajas.layer.wms.WmsLayer" > <property name="layerInfo" ref="wmsOrthoInfo" />
<property name="baseWmsUrl" value="http://ogc.beta.agiv.be/ogc/wms/orthoklm" /> <property name="version" value="1.3.0" /> <property name="format" value="image/jpeg" /> <property name="styles" value="" />
<property name="authentication"> <bean class="be.geomajas.layer.wms.HttpAuthentication"> <property name="user" value="<the user name>" /> <property name="password" value="<password>" /> <property name="realm" value="<optional realm>" /> <property name="applicationUrl" value="<the URL for this web application>" /> </bean> </property> </bean>
section.para: Let us go over the properties for the authentication bean:

row.entry: The HTTP realm for this user. This is an optional value.
Authentication method to use. Options are WmsAuthenticationMethod.BASIC (default) and WmsAuthenticationMethod.URL.
Key which is used to pass the user name when using the URL authentication type.
Key which is used to set the password when using the URL authentication type.
